transcript.text: native speakers of the language are
usually the ones with a near perfect
understanding of the language however a
nuanced understanding of one's
indigenous language does not necessarily
equate a perfect output that is having a
sound knowledge of a language does not
necessitate a sound usage of the
language in question this brings us to
the concept of competence and
performance which was introduced by the
American Ling EST gnome of Rim Chomsky
what is competence competence refers to
the abstract knowledge of the workings
of a language that is a sound
understanding of the principles and
rules of a language as well as its usage
when a person typically a native speaker
has a well-rounded knowledge of their
language they tend to have a strong
level of proficiency in the use of the
language take for instance a Britain
born in the United Kingdom who also grew
up there would have greater Proficiency
in the use of the English language than
someone who speaks the language as their
second language being proficient in the
use of a language means having the
ability to use a language perfectly to
an extent due to knowledge of its
workings and this is what competence is
concerned with however it is worthy of
note that competence is a mental
construct that is competence is an
abstraction for having a sound knowledge
of a language
and so it is not a concrete phenomenon
that can be perceived with the sense
organs you can never be sure of what a
person knows until you hear them talk
and this is the case with competence the
understanding of a language a person PES
is stored in their brain particularly
the side of the brain that is
responsible for language related
function known as the left hemisphere
for most people the left hemisphere is
the left part of the brain containing
the Brooker area which is responsible
for speech production and the wck area
which is responsible for speech
reception and understanding of speech it
is said that no two persons have the
same level of competence in a language
no matter how vast they are it is either
one has more competence or less
competence than the other knowing a
language to the bone is not enough using
the language is what reveals how good a
person really is in a language and this
brings us to the concept of performance
what is performance performance has to
do with the use of language in simple
terms it is concerned with how we
express ourselves in a language compared
to our understanding of the language
performance in a language is largely
determined by a number of factors
ranging from stage fright to word
searching which includes the use of
fillers in speech such as a um you know
uh Etc other of such factors include
sick nesses especially those that are
capable of obstructing fluent speech
such as stuttering dis arria and apexia
of speech there could also be
physiological factors such as hearing
impairment Brawn stroke genetic disorder
Etc all these affect the use of language
but that does not mean that it is
impossible to achieve fluent speech some
persons have a natural gift for speaking
While others have to undergo
professional trainings on how to speak
effectively after which they become
professional public speakers public
speakers are known for their excellent
use of language and their fluency it
almost appears as though they are never
affected by any of the mentioned factors
that affect the use of language public
speakers are not the only ones with
outstanding performance in the use of
language teachers lecturers coaches
politicians musicians content creators
charismatic individuals also depict
remarkable use of language in their
speech a good example of an individual
with great performance in language is
Steve Harvey just as there are factors
that hinder performance there are also
factors that promote it such as courage
boldness education social status
Financial stability experience Etc all
these help in the production of fluent
speeches so competence and performance
are are Concepts in linguistics that are
concerned with language knowledge and
language use while competence has to do
with the knowledge a person has of a
language usually a native speaker
performance is concerned with how people
use language in real life and it is
influenced by a number of factors
ranging from social to
physiological understanding the concept
of competence and performance will
better inform you on how knowledge and
output in terms of language can differ
see you soon
[Music]
